propertiesClass.name: tabButtonTemplate
propertiesClass.description:
This is used to allow consumer to provide their own custom tab buttons like: <ng-template #tabButtonTemplate let-tab let-index> <ag-button type="faux" [isBordered]="true" mode="primary" role="tab" [attr.aria-selected]="tab.isActive"

{{ tab.title }}
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
This is used to allow consumer to provide their own custom tab buttons like:
<ng-template #tabButtonTemplate let-tab let-index>
<ag-button
type="faux"
[isBordered]="true"
mode="primary"
role="tab"
[attr.aria-selected]="tab.isActive"
>
{{ tab.title }}
</ag-button>
</ng-template>

variables.name: Large
Rounded
Small
Template
variables.defaultValue:
(args: ButtonComponent) => ({
  props: {
    propInput: {
      onClicked: actions.onClicked,
      type: args.type || 'button',
      size: args.size || 'medium',
      css: args.css || undefined,
      mode: args.mode || undefined,
      isBordered: args.isBordered || false,
      isBlock: args.isBlock || false,
      isBlank: args.isBlank || false,
      isRaised: args.isRaised|| false,
      isCircle: args.isCircle || false,
      // Literally look if false otherwise it's true \_()_/
      isSkinned: args.isSkinned === false ? args.isSkinned : true,
      isRounded: args.isRounded || false,
      isDisabled: args.isDisabled || false,
    }
  },
  template: `<ag-button
    [mode]="propInput.mode"
    [isBlank]="propInput.isBlank"
    [type]="propInput.type"
    [size]="propInput.size"
    [css]="propInput.css"
    [isBordered]="propInput.isBordered"
    [isRaised]="propInput.isRaised"
    [isDisabled]="propInput.isDisabled"
    [isCircle]="propInput.isCircle"
    [isBlock]="propInput.isBlock"
    [isSkinned]="propInput.isSkinned"
    [isRounded]="propInput.isRounded"
    (handleClick)="propInput.onClicked($event)"
  >Go</ag-button>`,
})

variables.name: Template
TextArea
TextAreaLarge
TextAreaSmall
Underlined
UnderlinedWithBackground
WithTabButtonTemplate
variables.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `
{{ tab.title }}

Custom tab buttons can be achieved by using your own button (which can be AgnosticUI Buttons) using ngTemplateOutlet of #tabButtonTemplate as we have done here.


Note, that it's important to pass the type="faux" prop if you use an AgnosticUI Button (or just use a div if you're making your own). Ultimately, we want a div that is styled like a button. This "tab button div" will get wrapped internally by ag-tabs with a button of its own. Doing this prevents an a11y violation of nesting focusable elements.


You will also want to give these buttons the role of tab and utilize the aria-selected attribute as we've done here (TODO -- link to GitHub source).

 Tab 2 content `, })

src/stories/ag/src/lib/Button.stories.ts.defaultValue:
(args: ButtonComponent) => ({
  props: {
    propInput: {
      onClicked: actions.onClicked,
      type: args.type || 'button',
      size: args.size || 'medium',
      css: args.css || undefined,
      mode: args.mode || undefined,
      isBordered: args.isBordered || false,
      isBlock: args.isBlock || false,
      isBlank: args.isBlank || false,
      isRaised: args.isRaised|| false,
      isCircle: args.isCircle || false,
      // Literally look if false otherwise it's true \_()_/
      isSkinned: args.isSkinned === false ? args.isSkinned : true,
      isRounded: args.isRounded || false,
      isDisabled: args.isDisabled || false,
    }
  },
  template: `<ag-button
    [mode]="propInput.mode"
    [isBlank]="propInput.isBlank"
    [type]="propInput.type"
    [size]="propInput.size"
    [css]="propInput.css"
    [isBordered]="propInput.isBordered"
    [isRaised]="propInput.isRaised"
    [isDisabled]="propInput.isDisabled"
    [isCircle]="propInput.isCircle"
    [isBlock]="propInput.isBlock"
    [isSkinned]="propInput.isSkinned"
    [isRounded]="propInput.isRounded"
    (handleClick)="propInput.onClicked($event)"
  >Go</ag-button>`,
})

src/stories/ag/src/lib/Tabs.stories.ts.name: WithTabButtonTemplate
src/stories/ag/src/lib/Tabs.stories.ts.defaultValue:
() => ({ template: `
{{ tab.title }}

Custom tab buttons can be achieved by using your own button (which can be AgnosticUI Buttons) using ngTemplateOutlet of #tabButtonTemplate as we have done here.


Note, that it's important to pass the type="faux" prop if you use an AgnosticUI Button (or just use a div if you're making your own). Ultimately, we want a div that is styled like a button. This "tab button div" will get wrapped internally by ag-tabs with a button of its own. Doing this prevents an a11y violation of nesting focusable elements.


You will also want to give these buttons the role of tab and utilize the aria-selected attribute as we've done here (TODO -- link to GitHub source).

 Tab 2 content `, })
